reviewText: Can't unenrolled
no

The course material is excellent - however the way Coursera handles timelines is really frustrating. If you choose to learn 2 days a week, the test due dates still assume you're learning 5 days a week! There is no way I can learn the whole week's content in two days, so inevitably the tests are going to be submitted overdue (if that's even possible?) It's very demoralising when starting out on a new course, unless you're able to study full-time, to learn within the first week that you're guaranteed to fail. I'm going to try to continue learning at my own pace. I'm not sure if this is even allowed.

it's good to have a structure wit the videos but : 1) there are more than 50 vocabulary words that are missing, 2) there aren't enough exercises to prepare for the grammar exercises in HSK 4 test. It was good for HSK 1-3 but I would not recommend using this course to prepare for HSK 4.

This course is good if you wanna WASTE your time.The translation of some words is wrong or doesn't relate to the text content. I totally dislike the voice and way of speaking of one of the teachers (if I start to study Chinese with such a tutor I will definitely speak with such a high voice and it will sound weird). Texts and teaching way are old fashioned, boring, and don't motivate to do anything.I got this course for free, but I feel sorry for those students who pay for this through Coursera or even study at Peking University. I experienced much more effective and interesting courses before and I won't come back to any other online courses from Peking University. P.S. And I wish if teachers who work for this course could prepare more examples and not just copy tasks from HSK books. It shows that they are incompetent teachers.

I like that we were not taught every vocabulary word before the practice tests. However I with that the rest of the vacab. could be introduced after. Now I must go find another class, or learn the rest of the vocab. on my own with ought it being put into context like week 1-6. For this reason, I give this course a 6 out of 10. And would only recumbent it to someone after they have learned all the vocabulary works prior to this course.Â
This course helped me to be more consistent with my chinese study however it doesn't help that much with HSK4 studying. It helps indeed with chinese studying and the last 4 weeks are very useful.

Mâ€‹any course details are too shallow and at the same time not effective enough. There should be more dialogues. There should be more teacher feedback and stimulation to use the newly learned words, phrases, and a combination of the different parts. In reality, someone who can manage the entire course, does not need to be good at speaking and using Chinese.
Better explain the sentence structures in each situation

This is a coherent course that covers the main areas needed. However, I would have preferred more work on summarising the main areas that are required to memorize. For instance, a summary page of key sentence structures and sentences that learners can then apply to their learning. I really liked the pace of the course, it pushed me to work almost every day which meant, my recall of characters increased. Very accessible course, there is a big jump between this course and getting a great score on the HSK 4 course, but it was an enjoyable journey. Thank you to the instructors.
Great course, the Chinese parts are amazing. But there are lot of mistakes in the translations and the notes/quizzes are sometimes out of order.

1 star is missing because the opinion box on every week course can't type in Mandarin which made me confused and mad.Overall, the course is excellent I hope someday I can go to Peking University to pursue my study in Chinese! The material itself is based on HSK, and material videos are also teached by amazing teachers.
I am giving only four stars because sometimes the titles and the videos didn't totally match up.  Otherwise the course material is ok, the examples are good.
Very nice course: can highly recommend
Great course. I would recommend everyone preparing for HSK 4 to take it.
tâ€‹he video clip is too short. Love the quiz not too easy or too hard very useful for hsk test and i really learnt a lot of useful vocab fron this course

This course is a very good test preparation course. The teachers have clear, easily understood spoken Chinese, the videos are concise and helpful, and the course layout covers a lot of vocabulary and grammar quite well with listening and reading passages used in every lesson. I only wish difficult grammar points had more content devoted to them rather than just a simple two example slide; you may need to seek out supplementary support for some grammar structures.
this course was extemly helpful, I was able to pass HSK 4 exam even though I didn't complete the whole content. I do wish there were more exercises or cheat ways to do the reading part

Excellent approach. A lot of listening and reading material and exhaustive review of all HSK 4 vocabulary with many practical exercises that help a lot.
It is ultimately the best way to prepare HSK4

Great course - easy to follow. However, students need to work on more materials to actually pass the HSK 4 level. I use this online course to go through what I have already learned. If someone uses this course to learn new materials, I'm afraid it's not enough.
IT HELP IN THE PREPARATION OF HSK 4 ALOT
Great, professional course. I completed it online and I'm very satisfied about it.
This course was great. I improved my grammar, vocabulary, listening and speaking substantially. Thanks to both instructors for preparing this great course.
